InferenceÔÉÅ

class phasegen.inference.Inference(x0: Dict[str, float | int | None], bounds: Dict[str, Tuple[float | int | None, float | int | None]], dist: Callable[[...], phasegen.distributions.Coalescent], loss: Callable[[phasegen.distributions.Coalescent], float], parallelize: bool = True, pbar: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

The Inference class is designed to perform arbitrary inference using the provided loss function, through coalescent simulation based on phase-type theory. The optimization is performed via the BFGS algorithm from scipy.

Example:

>>> def loss_fn(a=0, b=0):
...     return (a - 2) ** 2 + (b - 3) ** 2
...
>>> x0 = {'a': 0, 'b': 0}
>>> bounds = {'a': (None, None), 'b': (None, None)}
>>> inf = Inference(x0, bounds, loss_fn, None)
>>> result = inf.run()
__init__(x0: Dict[str, float | int | None], bounds: Dict[str, Tuple[float | int | None, float | int | None]], dist: Callable[[...], phasegen.distributions.Coalescent], loss: Callable[[phasegen.distributions.Coalescent], float], parallelize: bool = True, pbar: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Initialize the class with the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • x0 (Dict[str, UnionType[float, int, None]]) ‚Äì Dictionary of initial numeric guesses for parameters to optimize.

  • bounds (Dict[str, Tuple[UnionType[float, int, None], UnionType[float, int, None]]]) ‚Äì Dictionary of tuples representing the bounds for each parameter in x0.

  • dist (Callable[..., Coalescent]) ‚Äì Callback returning the configured coalescent distribution on which the inference is based on. The parameters specified in x0 and bounds are passed as keyword arguments.

  • loss (Callable[[Coalescent], float]) ‚Äì The loss function. This function must return a single numerical value that is to be minimized. It receives as argument the coalescent distribution returned by the callback specified as dist.

  • parallelize (bool) ‚Äì Whether to parallelize the simulations.

  • pbar (bool) ‚Äì Whether to show a progress bar.

x0: Dict[str, UnionType[float, int, None]]ÔÉÅ

Dictionary of initial numeric guesses for parameters to optimize.

bounds: Dict[str, Tuple[UnionType[float, int, None], UnionType[float, int, None]]]ÔÉÅ

Dictionary of tuples representing the bounds for each parameter in x0.

dist: Callable[..., Coalescent]ÔÉÅ

Callback returning the configured coalescent distribution.

loss: Callable[[Coalescent], float]ÔÉÅ

Loss function.

Whether to parallelize the simulations.

pbar: boolÔÉÅ

Whether to show a progress bar.

result: Optional[OptimizeResult]ÔÉÅ

Optimization result

params_inferred: DictÔÉÅ

Inferred parameters.

loss_inferred: Optional[float]ÔÉÅ

Loss of the best optimization run

dist_inferred: Optional[Coalescent]ÔÉÅ

Coalescent distribution of best run

Progress bar

run()ÔÉÅ

Result of the optimization procedure.

Return type:
